title: Need help identifying DIN-style webfont (link included)
content:
if you visit the link below, the font in question is the one that says "One collection. Amazing quality." I have a browser extension to identify web-fonts which is calling this one "Frank" but I can find no font by that name that looks like that.

[http://www.shutterstock.com/subscribe](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417095449/http:/www.shutterstock.com/subscribe "http://www.shutterstock.com/subscribe")

Also, speaking of shutterstock: anyone know their logofont or is it custom?

Thanks in advance!
author: Niko Kast

comments.content:
I think Frank on the site is a typeface by Miles Newlyn.  
Frank had been sold before at MyFonts and probably at FontShop as well, but it seems it’s no longer available.  
You might want to contact him.  
 [https://twitter.com/milesnewlyn](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417095449/https:/twitter.com/milesnewlyn "https://twitter.com/milesnewlyn")
